data.text: @archer101au @VictorKTey @LibDemAus @UnitedAusParty Yep, we put them in ‘power’ and then the bastards run amok. It ain’t their money to waste or give to the climate raping Fossil Fuel (already mega rich) mates of theirs. But yet they do. They no longer serve the countries or the peasants best interests.

@VictorKTey @LibDemAus @Alan60619610 @UnitedAusParty Er - Lib and Labor ARE entrenched. In every election, they can claim a mandate due to pref voting. This election, only 2/3 or voters really support them yet they can always claim a mandate. AV is a terrible system for minor parties - you get no representation OR influence

@archer101au @LibDemAus @Alan60619610 @UnitedAusParty FPTP would either water down the top 2 parties so they can appeal to the most voters or it will help the opposition rise to power as the other side will have a split vote count. We do not want the US system of elections. That will entrench Liberal and Labor.

@VictorKTey @LibDemAus @Alan60619610 @UnitedAusParty Please. I completely understand it. Pref voting makes the LibDems irrelevant. If you could take 5-10% of the Lib vote in FPTP, they could not win and would have to address your voters concerns. Now, they just ignore you and we are forced to transfer our vote to them anyway.

@archer101au @LibDemAus @Alan60619610 @UnitedAusParty Preferential voting is the voting populous deciding on a single candidate from multiple options. It’s not MPs voting yes/no on a bill that needs a majority to pass. I’m beginning to suspect you both are condemning something you don’t even fully understand…

@archer101au @LibDemAus @Alan60619610 @UnitedAusParty If the smaller party gets enough #1 preferences to come second, then either Liberal or Labor’s preferences will flow to them. The issue is not with the preferential system. We just need to work hard to be one of the top two parties for the electorate.

@archer101au @LibDemAus @Alan60619610 @UnitedAusParty If your vote exhausts, it doesn’t mean the party most preferred isn’t elected. It just means you had no say in the remaining two parties. You send a message by helping a smaller party have a larger preference 1 vote. They pay attention to that and it also affects their funding.

@VictorKTey @archer101au @LibDemAus @UnitedAusParty No, but it does mean that a bunch of greedy for fossil fuel money arseholes that, I don’t want to have any chance of getting my vote, will more than likely end up with it! And that ‘sucks dogs dicks!’

@archer101au @VictorKTey @LibDemAus @UnitedAusParty Yep, they’ve set themselves up very nicely with the ‘two party preferred system haven’t they! We get stuck with Shit Party 1, or Shit Party 2. They’re BOTH just as greedy for the dirty, planet murdering, fossil fuel money as each other!
